intro: Hedeoma costata var. costata, commonly known as narrowleaf hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into fluffy, seed-filled capsules. The species is known for its adaptability to arid environments and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
